alert.note: Alert for Adams; Brown; Clermont; Hamilton; Highland; Hocking; Pike; Ross; Scioto (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 05 at 3:07AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of Southeast Indiana, Kentucky and Ohio, including the following counties, in Southeast Indiana, Dearborn, Ohio, Ripley and Switzerland. In Kentucky, Boone, Bracken, Campbell, Carroll, Gallatin, Grant, Kenton, Lewis, Mason, Owen, Pendleton and Robertson. In Ohio, Adams, Brown, Clermont, Hamilton, Highland, Hocking, Pike, Ross and Scioto. * WHEN...Through this evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - In a very moist environment, showers and thunderstorms will result in rainfall of 1 to 2 inches. Slow moving showers and thunderstorms that repeatedly move over the same areas could produce locally higher rainfall totals.
info.instruction: People in the watch area should keep an eye on the weather and be prepared for immediate action should heavy rains and flooding occur or a Flash Flood Warning be issued. Avoid low-lying areas and be careful when approaching highway dips and underpasses.

area.areaDesc: Adams; Brown; Clermont; Hamilton; Highland; Hocking; Pike; Ross; Scioto
